conclusion: Analyze the temperature profile and behavior of the droplet to determine the mass fraction that freezes.
Temperature decreases linearly below 2 km, and is constant below 2 km.
Droplet melts at the constant temperature of the atmosphere below 2 km, which is 0°C.
Mass fraction of the droplet that melts is the ratio of the area below the melting line to the total area.
Total area under the temperature curve is 40 km².
Area under the melting line is 32 km².
Mass fraction of the droplet that melts is 0.8.
Mass fraction of the droplet that freezes is 0.2.
Convert the mass fraction to a percentage: 20%.
